labels.label: The GenerateFlowFile processor is simply to trigger the flow via a cron
All hardcoded values need to be listed here including - base_path - source_system - country - partition - abfs location - databases (comma separated list)
Custom process group to obtain variables of interest To add more, please navigate to inside this process group
Please change to location of log directory to desired location

config.comments: This is the processor that calls the Spark tokenisation script to tokenise the required columns of a table, and save the result into the ADLS Gen2 storage underpinning the Public Cloud Data Hub cluster. All fields to start the job are extracted from the parameter file from the previous process group, the target partition for this job is extracted from the original acknowledgement file that triggered the flow to initially start (from the ListFile processor).

Split the incoming Hive commands from the Python script so that only one given table can be updated per flowfile, this is to allow some tables to fail, and some to succeed as opposed to all failing should something be wrong with the single Hive command.
Routing to two separate streams, if the Spark tokenisation script is successful, it will route to the success flow, otherwise it will route to the failure flow.

This process runs a msck repair table for a given table in the Public Cloud environment, this is to enable the Public Cloud table to recognise the new partition saved from the Spark tokenisation script
This will grab the XML file that corresponds to the source system and country pulled from the previous processor.

entry.key: Log level when file not found

value.name: Log level when file not found

entry.key: Log level when file not found

config.comments: This processor runs a Python script which checks for any failed tables. If it detects any, then those tables are removed from the list of successful tables that will run on the next processors to update the Public Cloud tables.
